sections.title: Camouflage Image
sections.subtitle: Python
sections.description:
This project was developed as the final assignment of Fundamentalms of Image Processing class.

The goal here was to implement a basic versão of the image camouflage method described on the paper Camouflage Images presented at SIGGRAPH 2010. The source code is on github.

sections.title: Faustoteca
sections.subtitle: Swift
sections.description:
An iOS app with the best lines of the brazilian TV presenter Fausto Silva, head of Domingão do Faustão. It was a fun project done a while ago to develop my knowledge in sound media usage on iOS apps.

The source code is on github.

sections.title: Crazy Helicopter Pilot Simulator
sections.subtitle: Swift ∙ Python
sections.description:
This project was developed as the final assignment of Human–Computer Interaction class.

It's an adaptation of a 3D helicopter simulator (forked from an open-source project) where the user can control it through hand movements, captured with the gyroscope of an iPhone.

The source code of the simulator adaptation and the mobile app is on github.

sections.title: UFRGS History Plotter
sections.subtitle: Javascript ∙ R
sections.description: This project allows UFRGS students to have a different visualization of their academic journey, by plotting graphs from their course history, obtained in the university's website. The source code is on github.

sections.title: Memes top d+
sections.subtitle: Javascript ∙ Python
sections.description: This is a pseudo-motivational meme bot. Using a pre-determined list of image tags and motivational quotes websites, the bot searches for an image and a quote and creates a random meme with them. Then, it is posted automatically on the facebook page.
